title: Contributor Code of Conduct
text: contributors maintainers project, pledge respect people contribute reporting issues, posting feature requests, updating documentation, submitting pull requests patches, activities. committed making participation project harassment-free experience everyone, regardless level experience, gender, gender identity expression, sexual orientation, disability, personal appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, age, religion. Examples unacceptable behavior participants include use sexual language imagery, derogatory comments personal attacks, trolling, public private harassment, insults, unprofessional conduct. Project maintainers right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct. Project maintainers follow Code Conduct may removed project team. Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported opening issue contacting one project maintainers. Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant (http://contributor-covenant.org), version 1.0.0, available http://contributor-covenant.org/version/1/0/0/

title: Contributing to movepub
text: outlines propose change movepub. detailed info contributing , tidyverse packages, please see development contributing guide.

title: Contributing to movepub
text: can fix typos, spelling mistakes, grammatical errors documentation directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. generally means ’ll need edit roxygen2 comments .R, .Rd file. can find .R file generates .Rd reading comment first line.

title: Contributing to movepub
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed).

title: Contributing to movepub
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("inbo/movepub", fork = TRUE). Install development dependencies devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e. just first header). Follow style described https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html.

title: Contributing to movepub
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Contributing to movepub
text: Please note movepub project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project agree abide terms.

title: Introduction to movepub
text: Frictionless Data open-source framework designed remove common barriers reading understanding data. transforming Movebank dataset “Frictionless Data Package” (Walsch Pollock, 2017), create set files better documented easier read programmatically, compared individual files downloaded Movebank. also necessary step transforming Darwin Core write_dwc(). build Frictionless Data Package starting directory containing CSV data files Movebank format (reference data GPS data), adding datapackage.json file provides persistent human- machine-readable definitions contents CSV files. Let’s try existing dataset, published Movebank Data Repository: Griffin L (2014) Data : Forecasting spring afar? Timing migration predictability phenology along different migration routes avian herbivore [Svalbard data]. Movebank Data Repository. https://doi.org/10.5441/001/1.5k6b1364 consists : DOI: Let’s bundle Frictionless Data Package: ’s : Initiate package create_package(). functions reexported movepub frictionless R package. Add DOI package ID. Add data two resources: reference-data gps. names standardized. using movepub::add_resource() (rather generic frictionless::add_resource()) also looked definition field Movebank Attribute Dictionary. ’s example field documented: package can now used transform Darwin Core (next step) saved datapackage.json file uses:
code: reference_data <- "https://datarepository.movebank.org/server/api/core/bitstreams/a6e123b0-7588-40da-8f06-73559bb3ff6b/content" gps_data <- "https://datarepository.movebank.org/server/api/core/bitstreams/df28a80e-e0c4-49fb-aa87-76ceb2d2b76f/content" doi <- "https://doi.org/10.5441/001/1.5k6b1364" # Don't use a http://dx.doi URL and exclude "www." package <-   create_package() |>   append(c(id = doi), after = 0) |>   create_package() |> # Bug fix for https://github.com/frictionlessdata/frictionless-r/issues/198   add_resource("reference-data", reference_data) |>   add_resource("gps", gps_data) package$resources[[1]]$schema$fields[[2]] #> $name #> [1] "animal-id" #>  #> $title #> [1] "animal ID" #>  #> $description #> [1] "An individual identifier for the animal, provided by the data owner. Values are unique within the study. If the data owner does not provide an Animal ID, an internal Movebank animal identifier is sometimes shown. Example: 'TUSC_CV5'; Units: none; Entity described: individual" #>  #> $type #> [1] "string" #>  #> $format #> [1] "default" #>  #> $`skos:exactMatch` #> [1] "http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/MVB/current/MVB000016/3/" write_package(package, "data/my_dataset")

what: Transform a Movebank dataset to Darwin Core
title: Introduction to movepub
text: Movebank dataset can converted Darwin Core using write_dwc(). Let’s try small dataset O_ASSEN. bird GPS tracking study dataset, available Movebank deposited Zenodo. write_dwc() requires dataset structured Frictionless Data Package (recognizable presence datapackage.json file). case O_ASSEN Zenodo. See previous section create Frictionless Data Package. Let’s create two directories: download dataset Zenodo local directory. Using local package avoids download data encounter issue: create package variable pointing local dataset: covers data. Darwin Core transformation also needs metadata record-level terms (e.g. dwc:datasetName, dcterms:license, etc.). default, derived package metadata (.e. Data Package properties). O_ASSEN example, DOI package$id, used dwc:datasetID: O_ASSEN doesn’t package metadata, meaning record-level terms like dwc:datasetName dcterms:license left empty. can provide parameters write_dwc(). Let’s transform data Darwin Core: results 3 files: occurrence.csv, emof.csv meta.xml. See write_dwc() function documentation transformation details. files can uploaded GBIF IPT publication. also want generate eml.xml file, see next section.
code: dir_source <- "data/o_assen/source" # Local directory for the source dataset dir_dwc    <- "data/o_assen/dwc"    # Local directory for the Darwin Core dataset read_package("https://zenodo.org/records/10053903/files/datapackage.json") |>   # Remove the large acceleration resource we won't use (and thus won't download)   remove_resource("acceleration") |>   write_package(dir_source) #> Downloading file from 'https://zenodo.org/records/10053903/files/O_ASSEN-reference-data.csv'. #> Downloading file from 'https://zenodo.org/records/10053903/files/O_ASSEN-gps-2018.csv.gz'. #> Downloading file from 'https://zenodo.org/records/10053903/files/O_ASSEN-gps-2019.csv.gz'. package <- read_package(file.path(dir_source, "datapackage.json")) package$id #> [1] "https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.10053903" write_dwc(   package = package,   directory = dir_dwc,   dataset_name = "O_ASSEN - Eurasian oystercatchers (Haematopus ostralegus, Haematopodidae) breeding in Assen (the Netherlands)",   license = "CC0-1.0",   rights_holder = "Vogelwerkgroep Assen" ) #>  #> ── Reading data ── #>  #> ℹ Taxa found in reference data and their WoRMS AphiaID: #> Haematopus ostralegus: 147436 #> (<https://www.marinespecies.org/aphia.php?p=taxdetails&id=147436>) #>  #> ── Transforming data to Darwin Core ── #>  #> ── Writing files ── #>  #> • 'data/o_assen/dwc/occurrence.csv' #> • 'data/o_assen/dwc/meta.xml' #> • 'data/o_assen/dwc/emof.csv' list.files(dir_dwc) #> [1] "emof.csv"       "meta.xml"       "occurrence.csv"

what: Transform a Movebank dataset to Ecological Metadata Language (EML)
title: Introduction to movepub
text: Movebank dataset can converted Ecological Metadata Language (EML) using write_eml(). Let’s try O_ASSEN dataset used previous section. time, dataset need Frictionless Data Package. requirement published DOI: Datasets (Zenodo, GBIF, Movebank) get DOI DataCite, also stores metadata dataset. write_eml() use DataCite retrieve metadata convert EML. Since non-mandatory metadata might present, function allows explicitely provide contact (used contact metadata provider) Movebank Study ID (used external link alternative identifier): Let’s transform metadata EML: resulting eml.xml file includes metadata. See write_eml() function documentation transformation details. eml.xml file can uploaded GBIF IPT publication. Notice default, write_eml() add extra paragraph explaining data transformed Darwin Core. can turn derived_paragraph = FALSE:
code:
doi <- "https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.10053903" contact <- person(   given = "Peter",   family = "Desmet",   email = "peter.desmet@inbo.be",   comment = c(ORCID = "0000-0002-8442-8025") ) study_id <- 1605797471 eml <- write_eml(   doi = doi,   directory = dir_dwc,   contact = contact,   study_id = study_id,   derived_paragraph = TRUE ) #>  #> ── Writing file ── #>  #> • 'data/o_assen/dwc/eml.xml' eml #> $packageId #> [1] "1934f9eb-ce0a-4a60-81b9-78d091c45571" #>  #> $system #> [1] "uuid" #>  #> $dataset #> $dataset$title #> [1] "O_ASSEN - Eurasian oystercatchers (Haematopus ostralegus, Haematopodidae) breeding in Assen (the Netherlands)" #>  #> $dataset$abstract #> $dataset$abstract$para #> [1] "O_ASSEN - Eurasian oystercatchers (Haematopus ostralegus, Haematopodidae) breeding in Assen (the Netherlands) is a bird tracking dataset published by the Vogelwerkgroep Assen, Netherlands Institute of Ecology (NIOO-KNAW), Sovon, Radboud University, the University of Amsterdam and the Research Institute for Nature and Forest (INBO). It contains animal tracking data collected for the study O_ASSEN using trackers developed by the University of Amsterdam Bird Tracking System (UvA-BiTS, http://www.uva-bits.nl). The study was operational from 2018 to 2019. In total 6 individuals of Eurasian oystercatchers (Haematopus ostralegus) have been tagged as a breeding bird in the city of Assen (the Netherlands), mainly to study space use of oystercatchers breeding in urban areas. Data are uploaded from the UvA-BiTS database to Movebank and from there archived on Zenodo (see https://github.com/inbo/bird-tracking). No new data are expected.

See van der Kolk et al. (2022, https://doi.org/10.3897/zookeys.1123.90623) for a more detailed description of this dataset.

Files

Data in this package are exported from Movebank study 1605797471. Fields in the data follow the Movebank Attribute Dictionary and are described in datapackage.json. Files are structured as a Frictionless Data Package. You can access all data in R via https://zenodo.org/records/10053903/files/datapackage.json using frictionless.



datapackage.json: technical description of the data files.

O_ASSEN-reference-data.csv: reference data about the animals, tags and deployments.

O_ASSEN-gps-yyyy.csv.gz: GPS data recorded by the tags, grouped by year.

O_ASSEN-acceleration-yyyy.csv.gz: acceleration data recorded by the tags, grouped by year.


Acknowledgements

These data were collected by Bert Dijkstra and Rinus Dillerop from Vogelwerkgroep Assen, in collaboration with the Netherlands Institute of Ecology (NIOO-KNAW), Sovon, Radboud University and the University of Amsterdam (UvA). Funding was provided by the Prins Bernard Cultuurfonds Drenthe, municipality of Assen, IJsvogelfonds (from Birdlife Netherlands and Nationale Postcodeloterij) and the Waterleiding Maatschappij Drenthe. The dataset was published with funding from Stichting NLBIF - Netherlands Biodiversity Information Facility." #> [2] "Changelog



Add alt-project-id to the reference-data.

Reference the latest Movebank Attribute Dictionary."                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                #> [3] "Data have been standardized to Darwin Core using the <ulink url="https://inbo.github.io/movepub/"><citetitle>movepub</citetitle></ulink> R package and are downsampled to the first GPS position per hour. The original data are available in Dijkstra et al. (2023, <ulink url="https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.10053903"><citetitle>https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.10053903</citetitle></ulink>), a deposit of Movebank study <ulink url="https://www.movebank.org/cms/webapp?gwt_fragment=page=studies,path=study1605797471"><citetitle>1605797471</citetitle></ulink>." $dataset$keywordSet[[1]]$keyword #>  [1] "animal movement"  "animal tracking"  "gps tracking"     "accelerometer"    #>  [5] "altitude"         "temperature"      "biologging"       "birds"            #>  [9] "UvA-BiTS"         "Movebank"         "frictionlessdata" #>  #>  #>  #> $dataset$creator #> $dataset$creator[[1]] #> '@id': ~ #> address: ~ #> electronicMailAddress: ~ #> individualName: #>   givenName: Bert #>   surName: Dijkstra #> onlineUrl: ~ #> organizationName: ~ #> phone: ~ #> positionName: ~ #> userId: ~ #>  #> $dataset$creator[[2]] #> '@id': ~ #> address: ~ #> electronicMailAddress: ~ #> individualName: #>   givenName: Rinus #>   surName: Dillerop #> onlineUrl: ~ #> organizationName: ~ #> phone: ~ #> positionName: ~ #> userId: ~ #>  #> $dataset$creator[[3]] The original data are available in Dijkstra et al. title: Prepare Movebank Data for Publication
text: Movepub R package prepare animal tracking data Movebank publication research repository. movepub can document data metadata following Data Package standard transform Darwin Core Ecological Metadata Language (EML) publication Global Biodiversity Information Facility (GBIF) Ocean Biodiversity Information System (OBIS). get started, see: Prepare study: guidelines data owners prepare study Movebank archiving, prior using package. Get started: introduction package’s main functionalities. Function reference: overview functions. Note Movebank users retain ownership data, use follow general Movebank terms use license terms set owner.

title: Prepare Movebank Data for Publication

title: Get DataCite metadata as EML — datacite_to_eml
code:
datacite_to_eml("10.5281/zenodo.10053903") #> $packageId #> [1] "da746c17-1aa4-401f-a362-0edb33f8ab57" #>  #> $system #> [1] "uuid" #>  #> $dataset #> $dataset$title #> [1] "O_ASSEN - Eurasian oystercatchers (Haematopus ostralegus, Haematopodidae) breeding in Assen (the Netherlands)" #>  #> $dataset$abstract #> $dataset$abstract$para #> [1] "O_ASSEN - Eurasian oystercatchers (Haematopus ostralegus, Haematopodidae) breeding in Assen (the Netherlands) is a bird tracking dataset published by the Vogelwerkgroep Assen, Netherlands Institute of Ecology (NIOO-KNAW), Sovon, Radboud University, the University of Amsterdam and the Research Institute for Nature and Forest (INBO). It contains animal tracking data collected for the study O_ASSEN using trackers developed by the University of Amsterdam Bird Tracking System (UvA-BiTS, http://www.uva-bits.nl). The study was operational from 2018 to 2019. In total 6 individuals of Eurasian oystercatchers (Haematopus ostralegus) have been tagged as a breeding bird in the city of Assen (the Netherlands), mainly to study space use of oystercatchers breeding in urban areas. Data are uploaded from the UvA-BiTS database to Movebank and from there archived on Zenodo (see https://github.com/inbo/bird-tracking). No new data are expected.

See van der Kolk et al. (2022, https://doi.org/10.3897/zookeys.1123.90623) for a more detailed description of this dataset.

Files

Data in this package are exported from Movebank study 1605797471. Fields in the data follow the Movebank Attribute Dictionary and are described in datapackage.json. Files are structured as a Frictionless Data Package. You can access all data in R via https://zenodo.org/records/10053903/files/datapackage.json using frictionless.



datapackage.json: technical description of the data files.

O_ASSEN-reference-data.csv: reference data about the animals, tags and deployments.

O_ASSEN-gps-yyyy.csv.gz: GPS data recorded by the tags, grouped by year.

O_ASSEN-acceleration-yyyy.csv.gz: acceleration data recorded by the tags, grouped by year.


Acknowledgements

These data were collected by Bert Dijkstra and Rinus Dillerop from Vogelwerkgroep Assen, in collaboration with the Netherlands Institute of Ecology (NIOO-KNAW), Sovon, Radboud University and the University of Amsterdam (UvA). Funding was provided by the Prins Bernard Cultuurfonds Drenthe, municipality of Assen, IJsvogelfonds (from Birdlife Netherlands and Nationale Postcodeloterij) and the Waterleiding Maatschappij Drenthe. The dataset was published with funding from Stichting NLBIF - Netherlands Biodiversity Information Facility." #> [2] "Changelog

what: Get WoRMS AphiaID from a taxonomic name — get_aphia_id
title: Get WoRMS AphiaID from a taxonomic name — get_aphia_id

title: Get WoRMS AphiaID from a taxonomic name — get_aphia_id

title: Get WoRMS AphiaID from a taxonomic name — get_aphia_id
text: Data frame name, aphia_id, aphia_lsid aphia_url.

title: Get WoRMS AphiaID from a taxonomic name — get_aphia_id
code: get_aphia_id("Mola mola") #> # A tibble: 1 × 5 #>   name      aphia_id aphia_lsid                          aphia_url aphia_url_cli #>   <chr>        <int> <chr>                               <chr>     <chr>         #> 1 Mola mola   127405 urn:lsid:marinespecies.org:taxname… https://… {.href [1274… get_aphia_id(c("Mola mola", "not_a_name")) #> # A tibble: 2 × 5 #>   name       aphia_id aphia_lsid                         aphia_url aphia_url_cli #>   <chr>         <int> <chr>                              <chr>     <chr>         #> 1 Mola mola    127405 urn:lsid:marinespecies.org:taxnam… https://… {.href [1274… #> 2 not_a_name       NA NA                                 NA        NA

title: Get term from the Movebank Attribute Dictionary — get_mvb_term
text: function deprecated favour move2::movebank_get_vocabulary(), offers functionality . Search term label Movebank Attribute Dictionary (MVB). Returns order: term matching prefLabel, matching altLabel error matching term found.

text: label Label term look . Case ignored -, _, . : interpreted space.

text: List term information.

what: Convert text with HTML to DocBook — html_to_docbook
title: Convert text with HTML to DocBook — html_to_docbook
text: Converts text HTML syntax DocBook, splitting paragraphs headers separate elements. subset HTML tags supported (see transformation details), HTML syntax removed.

title: Convert text with HTML to DocBook — html_to_docbook
code: html_to_docbook(string)

title: Convert text with HTML to DocBook — html_to_docbook
text: string Character (vector) may contain HTML syntax.

title: Convert text with HTML to DocBook — html_to_docbook
text: character vector HTML converted DocBook.

title: Convert text with HTML to DocBook — html_to_docbook
text: function splits text character vector, one element paragraph, header line break (\n). remaining HTML converted DocBook, tags supported EML paragraphs. HTML/DocBook syntax sanitized empty elements removed.

title: Convert text with HTML to DocBook — html_to_docbook
text: Capture EML eml <- movepub::write_eml() read EML::read_eml(). Assign output html_to_docbook() eml$dataset$abstract$para. Write EML EML::write_eml().

title: Convert text with HTML to DocBook — html_to_docbook
code:
html_to_docbook( c( "This is bold. Paragraph 1 Paragraph 2

", "What follows is a list:
  • Item 1
  • Item 2
" ) ) #> [1] "This is bold." #> [2] "Paragraph 1" #> [3] "Paragraph 2" #> [4] "What follows is a list: Item 1Item 2"

what: movepub: Prepare Movebank Data for Publication — movepub-package
title: movepub: Prepare Movebank Data for Publication — movepub-package
text: Prepare animal tracking data 'Movebank' (https://movebank.org) publication research repository. 'movepub' can document data metadata following Data Package standard transform Darwin Core Ecological Metadata Language ('EML') publication Global Biodiversity Information Facility ('GBIF') Ocean Biodiversity Information System ('OBIS').

title: movepub: Prepare Movebank Data for Publication — movepub-package
text: Maintainer: Peter Desmet peter.desmet@inbo.(ORCID) (Research Institute Nature Forest (INBO)) Authors: Sanne Govaert sanne.govaert@inbo.(ORCID) (Research Institute Nature Forest (INBO)) contributors: Sarah Davidson sdavidson@ab.mpg.de (ORCID) (Max Planck Institute Animal Behavior) [contributor] Research Institute Nature Forest (INBO) (00j54wy13) [copyright holder] NLBIF (https://www.nlbif.nl/move2gbif-gps-zendergegevens-van-dieren-mobiliseren-naar-movebank-en-gbif/) [funder] European Union (https://doi.org/10.3030/101112823) [funder]

what: Sample Movebank dataset with GPS tracking data — o_assen
title: Sample Movebank dataset with GPS tracking data — o_assen
text: sample Movebank dataset GPS tracking data, formatted Frictionless Data Package read read_package().

title: Sample Movebank dataset with GPS tracking data — o_assen
code: o_assen

title: Sample Movebank dataset with GPS tracking data — o_assen
text: object class datapackage (inherits list) length 7.

title: Sample Movebank dataset with GPS tracking data — o_assen
text: https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.10053903

title: Sample Movebank dataset with GPS tracking data — o_assen
text: sample derived Zenodo-deposited dataset Dijkstra et al. (2022), excludes acceleration data.

title: Sample Movebank dataset with GPS tracking data — o_assen
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # The data in o_assen was created with the code below o_assen <-   read_package("https://zenodo.org/records/10053903/files/datapackage.json") |>   remove_resource("acceleration") o_assen$title <- paste(   "O_ASSEN - Eurasian oystercatchers (Haematopus ostralegus, Haematopodidae),",   "breeding in Assen (the Netherlands)" ) o_assen$licenses[[1]]$name <- "CC0-1.0" o_assen$contributors[[1]]$title <- "Vogelwerkgroep Assen" o_assen$contributors[[1]]$role <- "rightsHolder" usethis::use_data(o_assen, overwrite = TRUE) } # }

what: Objects exported from other packages — reexports
title: Objects exported from other packages — reexports
text: objects imported packages. Follow links see documentation. frictionless create_package, read_package, read_resource, remove_resource, resources, write_package

what: Transform Movebank data to a Darwin Core Archive — write_dwc
title: Transform Movebank data to a Darwin Core Archive — write_dwc
text: Transforms Movebank dataset (formatted Frictionless Data Package) Darwin Core Archive.

title: Transform Movebank data to a Darwin Core Archive — write_dwc
code: write_dwc(   package,   directory,   dataset_id = package$id,   dataset_name = package$title,   license = NULL,   rights_holder = NULL )

title: Transform Movebank data to a Darwin Core Archive — write_dwc
text: package Frictionless Data Package Movebank data, returned read_package(). expected contain reference-data gps resource. directory Path local directory write files . dataset_id Identifier dataset. dataset_name Title dataset. license License dataset. rights_holder Acronym organization owning managing rights data.

title: Transform Movebank data to a Darwin Core Archive — write_dwc
text: CSV meta.xml files written disk. invisibly, list data frames transformed data.

title: Transform Movebank data to a Darwin Core Archive — write_dwc
text: resulting files can uploaded IPT publication GBIF /OBIS. corresponding eml.xml metadata file can created write_eml(). See vignette("movepub") example.

title: Transform Movebank data to a Darwin Core Archive — write_dwc
text: function follows recommendations suggested Peter Desmet, Sarah Davidson, John Wieczorek others transforms data : Occurrence core. Extended Measurements Facts extension meta.xml file. Key features Darwin Core transformation: Deployments (animal+tag associations) parent events, tag attachment (human observation) GPS positions (machine observations) child events. information parent event provided ID, meaning data can expressed Occurrence core one row per observation parentEventID shared occurrences deployment. tag attachment event often contains metadata animal (sex, life stage, comments) deployment whole. sex life stage additionally provided Extended Measurement Facts extension, values mapped controlled vocabulary recommended OBIS. event/occurrence created deployment end, since end date often undefined, unreliable /represent animal occurrence. visible (non-outlier) GPS records fall within deployment included. GPS positions downsampled first GPS position per hour, reduce size high-frequency data. possible deployment contain GPS positions, e.g. tag malfunctioned right deployment. Parameters metadata used set following record-level terms: dwc:datasetID: dataset_id, defaulting package$id. dwc:datasetName: dataset_name, defaulting package$title. dcterms:license: license, defaulting first license name (e.g. CC0-1.0) package$licenses. dcterms:rightsHolder: rights_holder, defaulting first contributor package$contributors role rightsHolder.

title: Transform Movebank data to a Darwin Core Archive — write_dwc
code: write_dwc(o_assen, directory = "my_directory") #>  #> ── Reading data ── #>  #> ℹ Taxa found in reference data and their WoRMS AphiaID: #> Haematopus ostralegus: 147436 #> (<https://www.marinespecies.org/aphia.php?p=taxdetails&id=147436>) #>  #> ── Transforming data to Darwin Core ── #>  #> ── Writing files ── #>  #> • my_directory/occurrence.csv #> • my_directory/meta.xml #> • my_directory/emof.csv  # Clean up (don't do this if you want to keep your files) unlink("my_directory", recursive = TRUE)

what: Transform Movebank metadata to EML — write_eml
title: Transform Movebank metadata to EML — write_eml
text: Transforms metadata published Movebank dataset (DOI) Ecological Metadata Language (EML) file.

title: Transform Movebank metadata to EML — write_eml
code: write_eml(   doi,   directory,   contact = NULL,   study_id = NULL,   derived_paragraph = TRUE )

title: Transform Movebank metadata to EML — write_eml
text: doi DOI original dataset, used get metadata. directory Path local directory write files . contact Person set resource contact metadata provider. provided person(). study_id Identifier Movebank study dataset derived (e.g. 1605797471 study). derived_paragraph TRUE, paragraph added abstract, indicating data transformed using write_dwc().

title: Transform Movebank metadata to EML — write_eml
text: eml.xml file written disk. invisibly, EML::eml object.

title: Transform Movebank metadata to EML — write_eml
text: resulting EML file can uploaded IPT publication GBIF /OBIS. corresponding Darwin Core Archive can created write_dwc(). See vignette("movepub") example.

title: Transform Movebank metadata to EML — write_eml
text: Metadata derived original dataset looking doi DataCite (example) transforming EML. following properties set: title: Original dataset title. description: Original dataset description. derived_paragraph = TRUE generated paragraph added, e.g.: Data standardized Darwin Core using movepub R package downsampled first GPS position per hour. original data available Dijkstra et al. (2023, https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.10053903), deposit Movebank study 1605797471. license: License original dataset. creators: Creators original dataset. contact: contact first creator original dataset. metadata provider: contact first creator original dataset. keywords: Keywords original dataset. alternative identifier: DOI original dataset. result, new DOI created publishing GBIF. external link alternative identifier: URL created study_id first derived related identifier original dataset. following properties set: type subtype update frequency publishing organization geographic coverage taxonomic coverage temporal coverage associated parties project data sampling methods citations collection data: applicable.

title: Transform Movebank metadata to EML — write_eml
code:
(write_eml(doi = "10.5281/zenodo.10053903", directory = "my_directory")) #>  #> ── Writing file ── #>  #> • my_directory/eml.xml #> $packageId #> [1] "0476966d-8074-4e94-aaa8-9fc3ae5ef8d5" #>  #> $system #> [1] "uuid" #>  #> $dataset #> $dataset$title #> [1] "O_ASSEN - Eurasian oystercatchers (Haematopus ostralegus, Haematopodidae) breeding in Assen (the Netherlands)" #>  #> $dataset$abstract #> $dataset$abstract$para #> [1] "O_ASSEN - Eurasian oystercatchers (Haematopus ostralegus, Haematopodidae) breeding in Assen (the Netherlands) is a bird tracking dataset published by the Vogelwerkgroep Assen, Netherlands Institute of Ecology (NIOO-KNAW), Sovon, Radboud University, the University of Amsterdam and the Research Institute for Nature and Forest (INBO). It contains animal tracking data collected for the study O_ASSEN using trackers developed by the University of Amsterdam Bird Tracking System (UvA-BiTS, http://www.uva-bits.nl). The study was operational from 2018 to 2019. In total 6 individuals of Eurasian oystercatchers (Haematopus ostralegus) have been tagged as a breeding bird in the city of Assen (the Netherlands), mainly to study space use of oystercatchers breeding in urban areas. Data are uploaded from the UvA-BiTS database to Movebank and from there archived on Zenodo (see https://github.com/inbo/bird-tracking). No new data are expected.

See van der Kolk et al. (2022, https://doi.org/10.3897/zookeys.1123.90623) for a more detailed description of this dataset.

Files

Data in this package are exported from Movebank study 1605797471. Fields in the data follow the Movebank Attribute Dictionary and are described in datapackage.json. Files are structured as a Frictionless Data Package. You can access all data in R via https://zenodo.org/records/10053903/files/datapackage.json using frictionless.



datapackage.json: technical description of the data files.

O_ASSEN-reference-data.csv: reference data about the animals, tags and deployments.

O_ASSEN-gps-yyyy.csv.gz: GPS data recorded by the tags, grouped by year.

O_ASSEN-acceleration-yyyy.csv.gz: acceleration data recorded by the tags, grouped by year.


Acknowledgements

These data were collected by Bert Dijkstra and Rinus Dillerop from Vogelwerkgroep Assen, in collaboration with the Netherlands Institute of Ecology (NIOO-KNAW), Sovon, Radboud University and the University of Amsterdam (UvA). Funding was provided by the Prins Bernard Cultuurfonds Drenthe, municipality of Assen, IJsvogelfonds (from Birdlife Netherlands and Nationale Postcodeloterij) and the Waterleiding Maatschappij Drenthe. The dataset was published with funding from Stichting NLBIF - Netherlands Biodiversity Information Facility." #> [2] "Changelog



Add alt-project-id to the reference-data.

Reference the latest Movebank Attribute Dictionary." the first GPS position per hour. The original data are available in Dijkstra et al. (2023, <ulink url="https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.10053903"><citetitle>https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.10053903</citetitle></ulink>), a deposit of Movebank study <ulink url="https://www.movebank.org/cms/webapp?gwt_fragment=page=studies,path=study1605797471"><citetitle>1605797471</citetitle></ulink>." $dataset$keywordSet[[1]]$keyword #>  [1] "animal movement"  "animal tracking"  "gps tracking"     "accelerometer"    #>  [5] "altitude"         "temperature"      "biologging"       "birds"            #>  [9] "UvA-BiTS"         "Movebank"         "frictionlessdata" #>  #>  #>  #> $dataset$creator #> $dataset$creator[[1]] #> '@id': ~ #> address: ~ #> electronicMailAddress: ~ #> individualName: #> "https://www.movebank.org/cms/webapp?gwt_fragment=page=studies,path=study1605797471" #>  #>  #>  #>  #>   # Clean up (don't do this if you want to keep your files) unlink("my_directory", recursive = TRUE)

title: movepub (development version)
text: write_eml() now separate function write_dwc() (#57). write_eml() now formats derived_paragraph DocBook (rather HTML), format supported EML GBIF IPT (#102). paragraph also shorter added end abstract (#76). New html_to_docbook() allows convert string character vector HTML DocBook. can use convert descriptions order valid EML (#101). write_eml() write_dwc() longer add [subsampled representation] dataset title (#76).

title: movepub (development version)
text: write_dwc() can now used unpublished dataset (.e. without metadata DataCite, required previously build-write_eml() functionality). record-level terms (e.g. dwc:datasetName) can provided arguments (#57, #72). write_dwc() (write_eml()) longer writes "." default, since allowed CRAN policies. user needs explicitly define directory (#70). write_dwc() now writes output file occurrence.csv (previously dwc_occurrence.csv) adds meta.xml file. sex life stage animal - addition dwc:sex dwc:lifeStage occurrence.csv - expressed extended measurement facts file (emof.csv), better support OBIS (#71, #77, #78). write_dwc() provides message regarding matching scientific names WoRMS Aphia IDs. IDs now clickable URLs, making easier verify match (#58). write_dwc() now modular, facilitating extension non-GPS tracking data (#66).

title: movepub (development version)
text: movepub now relies R >= 4.1.0 (move2 dependency) uses base pipes (|> rather %>%) (#98). Many functions frictionless now reexported movepub, longer load package create Data Packages (#54). get_mvb_term() deprecated favour move2::movebank_get_vocabulary() (#60). Sanne Govaert added author.

title: movepub 0.3.0
text: write_dwc() now makes use dplyr rather SQL transformation. reduces number dependencies (#61).

title: movepub 0.2.0
text: per OBIS recommendations, write_dwc() now adds scientificNameID occurrences, WoRMS LSID taxon. using new get_aphia_id(). cli package now used messages.
